case.name: Lynx Engineering Consultants Pty Ltd v The ANI Corporation Limited trading as ANI Bradken Rail Transportation Group (includes corrigendum dated 29 April 2008) [2008] FCA 555 (23 April 2008)

citances.sentence: 2) where the Costs Order was made as part of the judgment without hearing from the parties. [81] McDermott at para.25 per Kenny J, citing Dudzinski v Centrelink [2003] FCA 308 at para.11 per Spender J, in reference to the identical provision of O.35 r.7(2) in the Federal Court Rules . See also Lynx Engineering Consultants Pty Ltd v The ANI Corporation Ltd trading as ANI Bradken Rail Transportation Group [2008] FCA 555. [82] McDermott at para.25 per Kenny J, citing Wati v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural Affairs (1997) 78 FCR 543 at 549-552 per von Doussa, Moore and Sackville JJ. [83] See paras.32-66 above.

There was a further decision in WAD 219 of 2006 ( Lynx Engineering Consultants Pty Ltd v ANI Corporation Limited & Others (No 2) [2007] FCA 1510 ; (2007) 163 FCR 372 by Siopis J). The issue concerned preliminary discovery. Additionally, I gave a further brief decision in each of the matters on 23 April 2008 ( Lynx Engineering Consultants Pty Ltd v The ANI Corporation Limited trading as ANI Bradken Rail Transportation Group [2008] FCA 555). This concerned orders for confidential undertakings.
